meanings.definition: The outer extremity of a ship's yard
meanings.sent1: The sailor climbed to the yardarm to adjust the sail.
meanings.sent2: The flag fluttered from the yardarm in the wind.
meanings.sent3: When the seagull landed on the yardarm, it looked like a tiny dancer.
meanings.sent4: The sun perched on the yardarm of the sky, casting a warm glow.
meanings.sent5: The yardarm stretched out like a welcoming arm, guiding the ship.

meanings.definition: The horizontal spar on a mast from which sails are set
meanings.sent1: The crew hoisted the sail onto the yardarm for better wind catch.
meanings.sent2: The captain shouted orders to unfurl the sails from the yardarm.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the yardarm and pretended to be a lookout.
meanings.sent4: The yardarm held the sails like a giant hand, guiding the ship forward.
meanings.sent5: The yardarm creaked as the wind filled the sails, propelling the ship forward.

meanings.definition: The time of day when the sun is at the yardarm of a ship, around noon
meanings.sent1: The sailors gathered for lunch at the yardarm, enjoying the midday break.
meanings.sent2: The captain announced it was yardarm time, signaling the crew to rest.
meanings.sent3: At yardarm time, the ship's cook served delicious meals to the hungry crew.
meanings.sent4: The sun hung directly above, marking the yardarm time for the sailors.
meanings.sent5: The yardarm time brought a sense of peace as the crew relaxed under the sun.
